text: Julie Fedorchak (n√©e Liffrig; born 1968) is an American politician who is the member of the U.S. House of Representatives for North Dakota's at-large congressional district since 2025. She was a member of the North Dakota Public Service Commission from 2012 to 2025. She was appointed to the commission by Governor Jack Dalrymple. She won re-election to that position three times. ==U.S. House of Representatives== In February of 2024, Fedorchak announced her candidacy for the United States House of Representatives in the 2024 election. She ran under the focus of abortion, energy, and agriculture as issues she would focus on as a representative. Fedorchak's campaign was supported by U.S. Senator John Hoeven, Governor Doug Burgum, and former President Donald Trump. In June 2024, Fedorchak won the Republican nomination with 46% of the vote. She would win the election in November 2024. ==Personal life== Fedorchak was born in Williston, North Dakota in 1968. She graduated from the University of North Dakota. Fedorchak is married to Michael Fedorchak and they have three children. ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website * Personal Website Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:United States representatives from North Dakota Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Julie Fedorchak
